But when i activate the installer it says that the file is working but not for this comptuer type. Im using XP D:

i get a pop up saying 

Application Error: C:\WESTWOOD\REDALERT\RA95.EXE

An privileged instruction was executed at address 005c1fa4

how do i fix this?

READ THIS ALL BEFORE INSTALLING:

I haven't downloaded this but am a great fan of the original Red Alert, so I thought I'd help out some people having trouble. I hope the download is pretty simple, just the .iso files or something, so these instructions might not match exactly what you have downloaded but you can improvise and research yourselves.

1.  If they are .ISOs then mount them with deamon tools or similar, but don't click install when the first screen comes up. Exit this and open the CD up in explorer mode (right click and Explore).

2.  First you MUST remember to install the original setup in WINDOWS 95 COMPATIBILITY MODE (right click on the setup.exe --> Properties --> Compatibility --> Run in 95 mode). Install normally, it's pretty easy and very fast (this is a 1995 game we are talking about here).

3.  Unless these are already included here you need these three patches to play on XP or higher:

http://www.archive.org/details/Red_Alert_Patch

Follow the instructions there to extract the necessary files into your game directory. The first one is a general patch, the second a patch that enables play on XP and the third allows you to play over LAN (which is the absolute best way to play this wonderful classic).

4.  Once it is installed go into the game directory (probably in your program files or C:\WESTWOOD, wherever you installed it) and right click on RA95.exe. Go to the compatibility tab and make sure you check "Run in 256 colours". This game has that many colours and if you don't you will have green streaks all across the screen, shadows will be bright blue etc.


If you don't do these for XP or above you will have to play with the DOS version which is painful with a resolution of about 2x3 pixels (exaggeration haha).

Oh and I'm a bit of an expert with this game and have created some great maps, plus I love having massive duels (not the stupid rush tactics people use for these games), so if there are any installation problems or problems running the game, or you simply want somebody to verse occasionally just email me at boris.jaws@gmail.com. 

Enjoy!
Right click on Setup.EXE then choose Poperties, then go to Compatibilty. then mark the "Run this program in compatibility mode for" and select windows 95 ...problem solved ;)
